profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 17:39:24 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Microfilmed materials must be consulted on microfilm.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Biographical material, correspondence, legal and financial material, notes and writings, art work, scrapbooks, sketchbooks, printed material, subject files and photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REEL 4154: Five scrapbooks containing clippings, exhibition brochures, photographs of Pittman and of his works (1934-1969); and two sketchbooks containing European views of landscape and architecture (1927-1956).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REELS 4468-4472: Biographical material; correspondence, 1920-1900, with family, colleagues, students, and patrons, including Ivan Albright, Walter H. Annenberg, John Canaday, Blanchard Gummo, Edward Hopper, Edward G. Robinson, Ann Southern, and others; Pittman's will and estate papers; receipts, 1921-1980; 2 address books; school notebooks; writings by and about Pittman, including his "Drift of Consciousness" manuscript; 4 scrapbooks of drawings, 70 unbound drawings, and 2 prints; a menu decorated with sketches of acrobats and annotated "to H. Pittman from R. Marsh" and "E. Hopper"; files containing letters, printed material, and photographs on topics including Clare Boothe Luce (1946-1972), Margaret Sanger (1947-1974), greeting cards designed by Pittman (1960-1965), Pittman residences (1945-1974), Woodstock artists (1972-1975) and Guggenheim fellowships (1938-1956-contains a travel journal about Italy); a scrapbook of clippings (1938-1971) and clippings (1931-1985); exhibition announcements and catalogs (1930-1989), and other printed material; and photographs of Pittman, his family, friends, art classes (1945-1971), and works of art.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: ADDITION: Preliminary works of art by Pittman consisting of 1,538 sketches in watercolor, ink and graphite.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels 4468-4472 available for use at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel 4154 available at Archives of American Art offices, through interlibrary loan, at the Free Library of Philadelphia and at Bryn Mawr College.

altformavail.head: Reproduction Note
altformavail.p: Letters from Pittman to Margaret Sanger are photocopies.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Reels 4468-4472: Originals in the Edgecombe County Cultural Arts Council, Tarboro, N.C.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Reel 4154: Originals in Hobson Pittman House Collection, Bryn Mawr College.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Letters from Pittman to his cousin Lucy Cherry Crisp located in Collection no. 154, East Carolina Manuscript Collection, J. Y. Joyner Library, East Carolina University, Greenville, North Carolina.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Painter, art instructor; Philadelphia, Pa. Born in Epworth, North Carolina, Pittman moved permanently to Pennsylvania in 1918.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Material on reel 4154 lent for microfilming 1988 by Bryn Mawr College as part of AAA's Philadelphia Arts Documentation Project. Papers on reels 4468-4472 were lent by the Edgecombe County Cultural Arts Council, 1990, who received it from Pittman's niece, Alyce Weeks Gordon.The sketches were donated in 1997 from the North Carolina Museum of Art, which had received it from the Hobson Pittman estate.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Microfilm reels 4468-4472: Inventory of contents available at Archives of American Art offices.
